explanation: Claudia claims she was on vacation all last week and implies the swap could have happened anytime. But Clue 3 shows her vault keycard was used Wednesday evening at 6:45 PM, and her Portland hotel check-in was not until Thursday afternoon -- she was still in town and accessed the vault the night before leaving. Clue 2 reveals she sent a heavily insured package from the library that same Wednesday. Clue 1 confirms only she and Arthur had vault access. She swapped the letter Wednesday evening, mailed the genuine one to herself, and left for Portland the next day.
funFact: Forged Lincoln documents are so common that the FBI maintains a dedicated team of questioned document examiners who specialize in historical manuscript fraud.
